questions.question_text:
A new Windows operating system machine blueprint is created and is ready to be added to a new service catalog.
Which step must be performed for the catalog item to be visible to business users?

choices.C: Entitle a business user to add the blueprint to the catalog.
choices.D: Add the catalog item to the business group's reservation.
choices.A: Entitle the blueprint with all appropriate actions.

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is A.

After you create and publish blueprints and actions, you can create a vRealize Automation service, configure catalog items, and assign entitlements and approvals.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-981A9CE7-F249-47D5-BD05-4B32016D7B3D.html

As the question states that the blueprint is READY to be added to a new service catalog, that blueprint is yet published to a catalog item so no need to publish, we now must entitle actions to business users to be able to use it. so A is correct IMHO.

Answer is A, Same Source Provided by Downey
To make the catalog item available to users, a tenant administrator or business group manager must entitle the item to the users and groups who should have access to it in the service catalog.

Answer is C
proof is here : https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-CE003363-13C1-41B6-8E40-0AF666DC9FA3.html?hWord=N4IghgNiBc4CZwKZwAQBcD2KwoHaIHcUBnRAJwDcBLAY0RRrDUgwHMQBfIA

comments.content: No, answer C give a user the right to then publish it. that is not what this is asking. Publishing the blueprint B is the correct answer.

discussion.content: Even the documentation source provided by pseudorandom identifies Endpoints, Composite blueprints, and Property Definitions as supported content types. I say B, D, and F.
Yes. As per the given link, Answer is A,D,F
I am thinking A, D, F. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vRealize-Suite-Lifecycle-Manager/8.0/com.vmware.vrsuite.lcm.80.doc/GUID-502722AA-4348-4CA8-89CD-BC100003AE64.html

questions.question_text: Which three vRealize Automation content types are supported by content lifecycle management in vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Make available as a component in the design canvas

questions.question_text: Which option in a composite blueprint's settings allows an architect to modify the CPU and memory limits of provisioned virtual machines?

discussion.content: I say A, cause the referenced kb clearly identifies the primary log file location.

comments.content:
According to this it should be /storage/log/vmware/vcac/catalina.out or am I misreading?
vRealize Automation Server log is what it's labeled as.
yes. i would agree. vcac-config.log is meant for vRA configuration logs whereas catalina.out is the main log. Atleast, that's how i read the link shared by Riktam182.

questions.question_text: What is the primary log for the vRealize Automation appliance?

choices.C: The service account for the vCenter endpoint has not been assigned a role in vCenter.
choices.A: The service account password is using invalid special characters.
choices.D: The service account was entered in user principal name (UPN) format.
choices.B: The IaaS administrator entered an incorrect vCenter fully qualified domain name (FQDN) in the vCenter address.

discussion.content:
Given the information within this question, we cannot prove if answer A or D is correct.
I assume that the password contained a trailing equal (=), which results in this error.

My choice is A.

comments.content: Thanks for sharing a valid link. I agree D is the right answer. Good tricky question :)

discussion.content:
Correct answer is D.
The user name has to be domain\username and NOT UPN format.
Ref: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-3051E04E-C809-4E29-A3BF-51053BB2D7BC.html

Answer: A is correct
The reference URL is
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.install.upgrade.doc/GUID-6CB7D698-975D-41A4-8FC0-3EE40FE30203.html
The reference URL does not mention anything about special characters. Cannot confirm if A is correct.
